ara_vartanian
发送时间: 2005年12月8日 10:01
收件人: junit@yahoogroups.com
主题: [junit] A simple design question about Hibernate testing

I understand that a good unit tester ought not have a shared test
fixture and also that as few of the tests ought to test an actual
database as possible. But for those tests which indeed must test the
DAOs rather than a mock DAO, I was wondering if there was some
alternative to biting the bullet and rebuilding the SessionFactory
once per test. Or is this a case where it is warranted to tolerate the
smell of a SessionFactory built once per TestCase?
